quoteFirst: The country is very beautiful about here.
quoteLast: . We have just changed horses at Stony Stratford. The country is very pretty. About ½ past 1 o’clock we arrived at Towcester & lunched there.
title: The girlhood of Queen Victoria, vol. 1 (of 2)
author: Victoria, Queen of Great Britain, 1819-1901; Esher, Reginald Baliol Brett, Viscount, 1852-1930 [Editor]

quoteFirst: He can be found a little north of _Zeta_, the star denoting the extremity of the northern horn of the constellation _Taurus_. On the 16th, at
quoteLast: will be 3° 17′ north of the moon.
title: The Chautauquan, Vol. 04, July 1884, No. 10
author: Chautauqua Literary and Scientific Circle; Chautauqua Institution; Flood, Theodore L., 1842- [Editor]

quoteFirst: It is also on the meridian on the 1st, 15th and 30th, at 5:18 p. m., 3:38 a. m., 5:03 p. m. respectively. On the 2d it sets at
quoteLast: ; on the 15th rises at 11:23 p. m.; and on the 29th sets at 11:28 p. m. It is farthest from the earth on the 13th at 1:30 p. m.; and nearest to the earth on the 26th at 3:42 a. m.
title: The Chautauquan, Vol. 04, April 1884, No. 7
author: Chautauqua Literary and Scientific Circle; Chautauqua Institution; Flood, Theodore L., 1842- [Editor]

quoteFirst: This planet will be evening star throughout the month, setting as follows: On the 2d, at 2:28 a. m.; on the 16th, at 1:33 a. m.; and on the 29th, at
quoteLast: Its direct motion amounts to 41′ 32.1″ of arc. On the 3d, at 9 a. m., it is stationary. On the 5th, at 7:34 a. m., 1° 18′ north of the moon.
title: The Chautauquan, Vol. 04, February 1884, No. 5.
author: Chautauqua Literary and Scientific Circle; Chautauqua Institution; Flood, Theodore L., 1842- [Editor]
